title: Finding out the pattern with Pascal's Triangle.
text: We know that the variables in this pattern will follow the pattern in Pascal's triangle. You should use the row of Pascal's triangle where the second number is $$7$$.
speech: We know that the variables in this pattern will follow the pattern in Pascal's triangle. You should use the row of Pascal's triangle where the second number is  7 .
pacedSpeech: We know that the variables in this pattern will follow the pattern in Pascal's triangle. You should use the row of Pascal's triangle where the second number is   7

title: Finding out the coefficients.
text: The coefficients according to Pascal's triangle are $$1$$, $$7$$, $$21$$, $$35$$, $$35$$, $$21$$, $$7$$, $$1$$.
speech: The coefficients according to Pascal's triangle are  1 ,  7 ,  21 ,  35 ,  35 ,  21 ,  7 ,  1 .
pacedSpeech: The coefficients according to Pascal's triangle are   1

title: Expanding the polynomial.
text: Use the formula: $${\left(a+b\right)}^n$$ $$=$$ $$a^n$$ + $$___$$ $$a^n-1b^1$$ + $$___$$ $$a^n-2b^2$$ +... + $$___$$ $$a^1 b^n-1$$ + $$b^n$$ and fill in the blanks with the values from Pascal's triangle.
speech: Use the formula:  parentheses a plus b,  to the n-th   is equal to   a to the n-th  +  blank   a to the n-th minus 1 b to the first,  +  blank   a to the n-th minus 2 b squared,  +... +  blank  , a to the first b to the n-th minus, 1  +  b to the n-th  and fill in the blanks with the values from Pascal's triangle.
pacedSpeech: Use the formula:    a plus b,  to the n-th
a to the n-th minus 1 b to the first,
a to the n-th minus 2 b squared,
, a to the first b to the n-th minus, 1
and fill in the blanks with the values from Pascal's triangle.

title: Plugging in the coefficients.
text: By plugging in the coefficients found earlier, we get $$p^7+7p^6 q^1+21p^5 q^2+35p^4 q^3+35p^3 q^4+21p^2 q^5+7p^1 q^6+q^7$$.
speech: By plugging in the coefficients found earlier, we get  p to the seventh plus, 7 p to the sixth q to the first plus, 21 p to the fifth q squared plus, 35 p to the fourth q cubed plus, 35 p cubed q to the fourth plus, 21 p squared q to the fifth plus, 7 p to the first q to the sixth plus q to the seventh .
pacedSpeech: By plugging in the coefficients found earlier, we get  this expression
